info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN DAUPHIN... NORTHWESTERN YORK...EAST CENTRAL PERRY AND NORTHEASTERN CUMBERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 115 PM EDT... At 1229 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mechanicsburg, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Siddonsburg around 1235 PM EDT. Hogestown around 1240 PM EDT. Mechanicsburg around 1245 PM EDT. Shiremanstown around 100 PM EDT. Lower Allen and Camp Hill around 110 PM EDT. Lemoyne, New Cumberland and Steelton around 115 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Capital City Airport, Dauphin, City Island, Messiah College and Harrisburg Area Community College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
